properties.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Baldwin Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal; Mobile Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 9 at 8:59PM CST until January 11 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves will
continue to build to 4 to 6 feet tonight through Friday. For the
High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves will build
to 8 to 10 feet by Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory,
minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Rip Current Risk,
dangerous rip currents.

* WHERE...In Alabama, Mobile Coastal and Baldwin Coastal
Counties. In Florida, Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and
Okaloosa Coastal Counties.

* WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, from 3 AM to 9 PM CST
Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 PM Friday to
6 PM CST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 3 AM CST
Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Sunday
night.

* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated
road closures expected. Breaking waves can sweep people off
jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening
swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be
expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away
from shore into deeper water.
properties.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be
closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of
unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone
property.

Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening
surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside
infrastructure.

Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM FRIDAY TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 PM CST SATURDAY
